page.title: 12Scadbury Park.
page.content: Scadbury Park covers about 300 acres and lies between Chislehurst and St. Pauls Cray.It originally belonged to Scadbury Manor.It consists of woodland and farmland.It was bought by the Borough of Bromley in 1983 to be turned into a nature reserve. The woods include some very old oak and yew trees.The woods are very neglected. Bromley Council plans to improve the area by getting rid of diseased trees and thinning out the undergrowth. Footpaths are going to be made,along with picnic areas. The rest of the area is mainly pasture land.This part of the estate will be rented out to farmers.Hedges will be left to provide a refuge for wildlife. Foxes,badgers and rabbits are very common,as well as many types of birds. There are also some ponds which have moorhens,frogs,newts and dragonflies.
